meanings.definition: To beat or punish with a whip made of horsehair or leather.
meanings.sent1: The cruel master horsewhipped the disobedient servant.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy horsewhipped the horse to make it run faster.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher horsewhipped the students with harsh words.
meanings.sent4: The storm horsewhipped the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The angry mob horsewhipped the traitor for betraying them.

meanings.definition: To severely criticize or reprimand someone.
meanings.sent1: The boss horsewhipped the employee for making a mistake.
meanings.sent2: The journalist horsewhipped the corrupt politician in her article.
meanings.sent3: The comedian horsewhipped the audience with his sharp wit.
meanings.sent4: The disappointment horsewhipped her heart, leaving her feeling low.
meanings.sent5: The coach horsewhipped the team for their lackluster performance.
